turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about San Lorenzo in Piscibus.
turn.1: What happened to San Lorenzo in Piscibus in the 1200s?
turn.2: It was during this period that the church's structure, whose facade lay at the south side of "Piazza Rusticucci" after its confluence with the "Borgo vecchio" road, (both have been destroyed in 1936–37 during the destruction of the "spina dei Borghi"), was incorporated into the nearby "palazzi" of noble families and more or less became a private chapel of the Cesi family, which owned the nearby palazzo.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The shrine was heavily reworked in the Baroque style in 1659 by the architect Francesco Massan, an associate of Borromini's.
turn.6: In the same year, the church came into the possession of the order of the Piarists, which later had a double entrance façade added.
turn.8: This façade, now completely gone, was designed by the architect Domenico Navona in 1733.
turn.10: The church was held by the Piarist fathers into the early 20th century.
turn.11: Is there anything else that is important?
turn.12: The church underwent major changes when the central part of the Borgo neighborhood, the "Spina di Borgo," was demolished in order to construct the modern Via della Conciliazione.
